author: Staff Reporter
text:
Many students’ movements and political parties in Puducherry held demonstrations and demanded the arrest of Vice Chancellor P. Appa Rao and Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Labour and Employment Bandaru Dattatreya in connection with the suicide of Dalit research scholar Rohith Vemula at University of Hyderabad (UoH) on Sunday.

While the Radical Students’ Front of Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi (VCK) held a protest demanding the arrest of the Union Minister, Communist Party of India (Marxist-Leninist) [CPI(M-L)] of Puducherry State Committee called the suicide of the student an ‘institutional murder.’

In a press statement issued on Thursday, the State committee of CPI (M-L) alleged that the five Dalit research scholars were suspended on fabricated charges following instigation from the Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP), Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MLC Ramachandra Rao, Mr. Dattatraya and Union Minister for Human Resource Development Smriti Irani. “He, along with other students had been agitating to demand revocation of the unjust punishment, when he committed suicide,” said the press statement. The two Ministers, who branded the agitating students as anti-nationals, should be sacked from their posts, it added.
title: Dalit student’s suicide: Arrest of Minister demanded
